Albaron Mohamed

Two basic environmental requirements for a seagrass environment are sea water (or at least brackish water) and sufficient light for photosynthesis to occur. Another common need is an attachment point, although there are some free-floating species belonging to genera such as Sargassum and Gracilaria. Seaweed is usually found in the inshore zone (waters near shore) and in that zone it is more common on rocky beaches than on sandy or pebble beaches.
